p: Various extracts of Anagallis arvensis have shown strong antifungal activity [ 78– 81]. The plant has antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant effects [ 79], and molluscicidal activity [ 82]. Strong molluscicidal activity was found for its saponins, namely desglucoanagalloside B and anagalloside B [ 82]. An acetyl saponin isolated from the plant was found to possess marked taenicide activity [ 83]. Triterpene saponins exhibit oestrogenic activity [ 84]. Moroever, strong antifungal and antiviral activities of Anagallis saponins were also demonstrated [ 119– 121].
